comment: I will say that Dr. Park-Primiano herself isn't a bad teacher, it's just the way she handles the class. She is very tough on grading and expects an in-depth knowledge of the films we watch. The film's themselves aren't bad in any way, but the assignments that relate to the films are just awful to complete. All in all, this is just a tedious class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Get ready to watch boring, obscure movies and write about them. She comes off as condescending and rude in feedback/emails, grades harshly, and expects an absurdly high knowledge of film in your work. I've had an A in every film class I've taken but I'm not sure I will in this class. Film classes should be fun and insightful, this was dreadful.
rating_tags: Tough grader--So many papers--Graded by few things

comment: awful. she completely contradicts herself constantly and is outright hostile in emails
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Worst professor ever. This is my second time taking her because she's like the only one available for online film classes and both of her classes have been absolute nightmares. You never know what to expect for her writing, and she grades late and extremely harsh. She's very condescending in her responses to students and will make you hate film.

Contradicting due dates for assignments, half of the lectures and readings are missing, claims that you need no previous experience with film but does not explain topics that aren't intuitive to those with no background in film, ends up extending almost all due dates because of mistakes on her part, missing rubrics for discussion posts
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: I was blindsided by the amount of work required for this class. I took a 4-week film class, and her expectation was 4+ hours spent on the material daily. Discussion posts were considered extra credit, but I was graded poorly on them for not having a "sophisticated grasp" of the subject. Keep in mind that I have never taken a film class before.

This is the WORST professor I have ever had. She made me hate english classes. She is so strict and will grade so hard. She has no care for her students. This class should have been an easy A but she made it impossible. She freaked out at a student for not calling her by the name "Dr". She takes forever to grade and will be very hard on grading.

This is by far the worst professor I've ever had. If you are thinking of taking her DON'T. I mistakenly took her again since she is the only person doing Film history 3 and I am regretting it. What should be an easy A she makes impossible and her class is lecture heavy. Her lectures are so boring and she grades really harsh. BEWARE!

This class may be the worst class I have ever taken. I am absolutely dumbfounded by how terribly disorganized, incoherent, and overall stressful it was. Professor Park-Primiano's class made me begin to hate film- I think that anyone who is considering her classes must beware. Do not take her!
rating_tags: Tough grader--So many papers--Graded by few things

comment: This class was supposed to be a Film History class, not an essay-writing class. I took this class to learn and appreciate film & the rich history it had; instead, I felt like I hated films. Professor Park-Primiano is incredibly disorganized in this class and the assignments are incredibly heavy for a film class. Avoid this professor at all costs.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Horrible!! She didn't post any grades for MONTHS and then gave back our midterms with incredibly harsh grades the week before the final. She only wants her biases confirmed and if you don't mimic the incredibly specific writing style she likes, she docks points. Great way for a straight-A student to ruin their GPA.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: Seems like a nice person, but made the class 100x more difficult than it needed to be. Feedback also made no sense. She expects every single student to be a film connoisseur with infinite film knowledge and had horrible lectures that spent more time covering history than film content. Midterm was so complicated that our class had to beg for mercy.

DO NOT TAKE!! Literally the hardest class I've had&I'm a junior. The midterm was four different papers and the material is very complex and will take up a lot of your time. The professor is very kind and knowledgeable but if you're taking this class to simply fill a credit, don't! I'm an English major&I've never had a class write this much.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Lecture heavy

comment: I do not recommend this Professor. She is a very tough grader on her writing assignments and does not allow enough time for completion. Her weekly module schedule is from Thursday-Monday. So she only allows for 3 weekdays to complete 1-2 readings, watching a film and writing a discussion post for it. Her questions include difficult wording as well.

Dr. Park-Primiano has an infectious passion for film. Her class was fascinating and easy to keep up with. Her assignments have clear expectations, and her grading is fair. She is a very caring teacher. I had a personal tragedy this semester, and she was very supportive and understanding.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Caring
